page.title: 12Farming Life in Charnwood
page.content: The farms are fairly small and mostly owned by Industrialists where farming is a secondary interest.The lower land is sown with winter cereals/oilseed rape.The grass uplands are enriched and used for silage hay & grazing for horses,sheep,cattle_milking herds and fatstock.Where the M1 divides the land of a farm they keep sheep/beast but pigeons are the main interest.The largest breeder in UK.40,000sq ft of lofts house stock.{Benscliffe House, built in 1897 is a large house 6 bedrooms 5 acre garden swimming pool tennis court stabling.Well water only. The owner a businessman farms 12 acres woodland 20 acres arable/ pasture with 60 acres elsewhere.Their interests are mainly equestrian and they employ a groom and casual help.The{Quorn Hunt meet there once each season.The wife is involved in Hunt Support activities
